meanings.definition: The practice or methods of a charlatan.
meanings.sent1: His charlatanry was exposed when people realized he was selling fake medicine.
meanings.sent2: The charlatanry of the fortune teller was evident when her predictions never came true.
meanings.sent3: The charlatanry of the magician was revealed when his tricks failed to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his charlatanry like a ray of light piercing through dark clouds.
meanings.sent5: The charlatanry of the salesman was as transparent as a glass window.

meanings.sent1: His deceitful charlatanry fooled many unsuspecting customers.
meanings.sent2: The audience was amused by the exaggerated charlatanry of the street performer.
meanings.sent3: The comical charlatanry of the actor brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her charismatic charlatanry captivated the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The cunning charlatanry of the con artist left a trail of victims in its wake.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a charlatan.
meanings.sent1: The professor's charlatanry was evident when he claimed to have knowledge he did not possess.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the politician's charlatanry and refused to be swayed by his false promises.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's playful charlatanry entertained the audience with his witty jokes.
meanings.sent4: His charming charlatanry masked his true intentions, deceiving those around him.
meanings.sent5: The artist's creative charlatanry was revealed when his plagiarized work was discovered.
